Class DepositAccount

java.lang.Object
account.DepositAccount
All Implemented Interfaces:
AccountOption
public class DepositAccount extends Object implements AccountOption
Class to represent deposit type of account.

  • Constructor Details

    • DepositAccount

      public DepositAccount(Double cash, Integer period, Bank bank, Client client, Double percentOne, Double percentTwo, Double percentThree)
      Constructor of a class.
      Parameters:
      cash - - amount of money that account has.
      period - - duration of deposit account in days.
      bank - - reference to a bank that determines max and min amount of money to withdraw or deposit.
      client - - reference to a client that owns this account.
      percentOne - - percent if amount of money is invalid input: '<' 50.000.
      percentTwo - - percent if amount of money is in range 50.000 and 100.000.
      percentThree - - percent if amount of money is > 100.000.

    • moneyAccumulation

      public void moneyAccumulation()
      Method to accumulate money due to debit type of account.

    • checkPeriod

      public void checkPeriod()
      Method to check period when withdraw functionality is allowed.

    • depositMoney

      public void depositMoney(Double cash) throws InvalidDepositException
      Method to deposit money to account.
      Parameters:
      cash - - amount of money to deposit.
      Throws:
      InvalidDepositException - - exception to invalid deposit if deposit functionality is blocked.

    • withdrawMoney

      public void withdrawMoney(Double sum) throws InvalidWithdrawException, UnverifiedStatusException
      Method to withdraw money from account.
      Parameters:
      sum - - amount of money to withdraw.
      Throws:
      InvalidWithdrawException - - exception to invalid withdraw if withdraw functionality is blocked.
      UnverifiedStatusException - - exception to invalid withdraw if unverified user tries to withdraw money that exceed the limit.
